instruction: Prepare the vegetables: Peel and cut the potatoes into bite-sized pieces. Slice the onion and carrots into thin wedges or half-moons.

Optional blanching (snow peas): If using snow peas, bring a pot of water to a boil. Add the snow peas and blanch for 30 seconds to 1 minute. Drain and rinse under cold water to stop the cooking process.

Brown the beef: Heat the vegetable oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add the thinly sliced beef and cook until browned on all sides, about 3-4 minutes. Remove the beef from the pot and set aside.
Saut√© the onions: Add the sliced onions to the pot and cook until softened and translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add the potatoes and carrots: Add the prepared potatoes and carrots to the pot with the onions. Cook for another 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Pour in the liquids: Add the dashi stock, soy sauce, mirin, sake (if using), and sugar to the pot. Bring to a simmer over medium heat.
Return the beef: Add the browned beef back to the pot with the simmering sauce and vegetables.
Simmer until tender: Cover the pot and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the potatoes and carrots are tender. Adjust the heat to maintain a gentle simmer.
Add the snow peas (optional): If using snow peas, add them to the pot in the last 2-3 minutes of cooking.
Serve: Transfer the nikujaga to a serving dish. Spoon over the flavorful sauce and vegetables. Enjoy hot with steamed rice.
